data.title: List of companies owned by Paramount
data.meta_description: Listing of all companies (past and present) owned by ViacomCBS, a subsidiary of National Amusements. This section is for companies that handle film production and distribution Paramount Pictures Paramount Animation Paramount Players Nickelodeon Movies Viacom18 Studios Miramax (49%) BET Films...
data.text:
Listing of all companies (past and present) owned by ViacomCBS, a subsidiary of National Amusements.

Table format[]

Paramount subsidiary table Film production Paramount Animation Paramount Home Entertainment Paramount Players Paramount Digital Entertainment Miramax Nickelodeon Movies Television networks The CW CBS Sports Network CBS Home Entertainment CBS Media Ventures CBS Television Stations CBS Interactive CBS Records CBS EYE Productions CBS News Radio CBS Sports CBSN CBS News CBS Sports HQ CBS Watch CBS Studios Nick Jr. Nicktoons NickMusic Nick at Nite TeenNick Nickelodeon Magazine Nickelodeon Productions Nickelodeon Animation Studio MTV MTV2 MTV Entertainment Studios VH1 CMT CMT Music Paramount Network Comedy Central Logo Pop Comedy Central Records Other US networks Showtime BET BET Gospel BET Her BET Jams BET Soul The Movie Channel Network 10 Chilevisión Telefe Telefe Internacional Colors Channel 5 ViacomCBS International Studios Streaming Paramount+ Pluto TV Other subsidiaries VidCon Viacom Velocity Viacom Vantage Paws, Inc. Rainbow Mirage Studios Paramount Consumer Products Predecessors Viacom CBS Corporation Viacom (2005-2019) Paramount Communications Former UPN VIVA Paramount Parks DreamWorks Pictures Paramount Vantage Nick Games and Sports For Kids Eyemark Entertainment Paramount Stations Group Viacom New Media Viacom NEXT NickRewind Paramount Records Discovery People Worldvision Enterprises Nick 2 Noggin Voot Paramount Television Studios Viacom18 Studios

Film production[]

This section is for companies that handle film production and distribution

Closed or sold[]

This section is for companies that no longer exist due to closures or changes in ownership or industry. Predecessors of ViacomCBS are also included in this section.

Predecessors[]

Paramount Communications (purchased in 1994)

first Viacom (1971-2005)

second Viacom (2005-2019)

CBS Corporation (2006-2019)
